subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






May 8, 2007


                              		
                              		
                              	  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video



                              	
                              	  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation






TOP STORIES6 Arrested In New Jersey Terror Plot
Six men accused of plotting to kill soldiers on the Fort Dix Army base in New Jersey were arrested Monday night, the U.S.
                        Attorney's office said. A spokesman said the six men were planning to "kill as many soldiers as possible." More...
• Historic N. Ireland Deal Becomes Reality• Blast Kills 16 In Shiite Holy City
                     					| Watch• Midwest Braces For Major FloodingU.S.Midwest Braces For Major Flooding
The same group of storms that whipped up a devastating F-5 tornado in Kansas last week is producing heavy rains across the
                        Midwest. Missouri, in particular, has begun evacuating several communities in anticipation of major flooding later this week. More...
• 6 Arrested In New Jersey Terror Plot• Auto Loan Rates Higher For Blacks• Survivor Found In Kansas Tornado Rubble
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldBlast Kills 16 In Shiite Holy City
A car bomb has torn through a market in the Shiite holy city of Kufa, leaving at least 16 people dead, including women and
                        children. The U.S. military is relying on Shiite militants from the Mahdi Army to police some key areas around the capital. More...Watch: Sen. Snowe's Plan For Iraq
• Historic N. Ireland Deal Becomes Reality• Archaeologist Finds King Herod's Tomb• Rebels: 3 Nigeria Oil Pipelines Destroyed
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsA White House Dinner Fit For A Queen
The White House pulled out all the stops for President George W. Bush's first-ever white-tie state dinner to honor Queen Elizabeth
                        II. More...Watch: White-Tie Dinner For The Queen
• Sen. Lott Joins Republican War Weary• Obama: U.S. Needs More Fuel-Efficient Cars
                     					| Watch• Could Fred Thompson Please The Right?• More StoriesHealthRating The Best Diets
Consumer Reports surveyed diet plans to find out which was the most effective and easiest to follow. The magazine also talked
                        to people who have lost a lot of weight, to learn about their strategies. More...
• "Cocaine" Pulled From Shelves Nationwide• Study: Moms Of Autistic Kids Cope Well• D.C. Is "Sun-Smartest" City In U.S.• More StoriesSciTechAstronomers Spot Biggest Supernova Ever
A massive exploding faraway star, the brightest supernova astronomers have ever seen, has scientists wondering whether a similar
                        celestial fireworks show may light up the sky much closer to Earth sometime soon. More...
• Obama: U.S. Needs More Fuel-Efficient Cars
                     					| Watch• Are You A High Tech "Omnivore"?• Internet Gambling Ring Busted Near NYC• More StoriesBusinessAuto Loan Rates Higher For Blacks
Blacks have been charged higher auto loan rates than other auto buyers, federal research says. But the gap in loan rates could
                        narrow, and possibly disappear, as the result of recently concluded lawsuits. More...
• Gas Prices Keep Climbing
                     					| Watch• Alcoa Bids For Canadian Aluminum Rival• Dow Jones Bid Puts CNBC On The Defensive• More StoriesEntertainmentJudge Suspends Hasselhoff's Visitation
A judge has suspended David Hasselhoff's visitation rights with his two teen daughters after a videotape showing him apparently
                        drunk was leaked. More...Watch: Hassling 'The Hoff' On Tape
• Actress Kim Fields Has A Boy• Pennington: DUI Arrest Is "Wake-Up Call"• Justin-Cameron Reunite For "Shrek" Sake
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionTurning Over A Nouveau Leaf
French voters have elected a pro-American, conservative market reformer. While there's strong resistance to Nicolas Sarkozy's
                        proposals, he displayed promising political skill in winning a tough election, writes the National Review Online. More...Watch: France Elects Next President
• Sarkozy Won't Be Bush's French Poodle
                     					| Watch• What War? We Have Sanjaya!• Trying To Make Sense Of The Papers• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Susan Koeppen: Rating The Best Diets
Consumer Reports surveyed diet plans to find out which was the most effective and easiest to follow. The magazine also talked
                        to people who have lost a lot of weight, to learn about their strategies. More...

Picking Up The PiecesFor the first time since Friday's deadly tornado touched down in Greensburg, Kan., residents returned to try and pick up the
                                    pieces of their houses and lives. Hari Sreenivasan reports.
